title: Microgrid Islanding Operation
description: During a wider grid outage, a community microgrid must safely disconnect from the main grid and operate independently to keep power on for its local customers.

tasks.description: The microgrid controller detects the loss of voltage from the main grid.
tasks.expected_outcome: Controller identifies the start of an upstream outage.

tasks.description: The controller automatically opens the main switch, physically disconnecting the microgrid from the surrounding grid.
tasks.expected_outcome: System successfully and safely islands the microgrid.

tasks.description: The controller starts the microgrid's generators and uses its batteries to form a stable, independent grid, restoring power to the local customers.
tasks.expected_outcome: Microgrid successfully forms its own grid and maintains stable voltage and frequency.
